intro: Nassauvia glomerulosa f. struthionum, commonly known as the desert honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from spring to early summer. The plant has slender, branched stems and narrow, gray-green leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators in desert ecosystems.
